comments:
The 3.3.1 release appears incompatible with the 3.3.0 release.

Running eclipse 3.3.1 using the same configuration area causes all the open Java editors to be broken, with the exception attached below.  Accessing Preferences -> Java -> Folding also gives an error: "Could Not Accept Changes" "The currently displayed page contains invalid values."  It seems impossible to fix this problem using the Eclipse UI.  

Moving the configuration directory (such that a new one is created on launch) fixes the problem.  Unfortunately this causes the user to lose their global configuration settings.

Furthermore, if the user loads the old 3.3.0 version the 3.3.1 is again corrupted on next launch.

Exception:

Just trying to figure out what's going on, I've had this occur the other way round too (moving from 3.3.1 -> 3.3.0).  I experience this problem in conjunction with Bug 205954.

I've just discovered that removing configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/.bundledata.* between running 3.3.0 and 3.3.1 is enough to make the problem disappear, though it isn't ideal as we give users choice of which version to run.

>Just trying to figure out what's going on, I've had this occur the other way
>round too (moving from 3.3.1 -> 3.3.0).
Starting a workspace with an older build as used before is not supported and can corrupt it.

The other problem is bug 205954.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 205954 ***
